components.description: A tongue, sticking out. May be used as a childish sign of defiance. Alternatively: licking, in various contexts.
components.title: Tongue

description: A tongue, sticking out. May be used as a childish sign of defiance. Alternatively: licking, in various contexts.
title: Tongue

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Facial parts symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A tongue, sticking out. May beÂ used as a childishÂ sign of defiance. Tongue was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1. http://emojipedia.org/tongue/
emoji_net_data.name: tongue

bn:00105584a: Extending out above or beyond a surface or boundary

bn:00093282v: To have a taste; to excite a particular sensation by which flavour is distinguished.

bn:00019439n: The tongue is a muscular hydrostat on the floors of the mouths of most vertebrates which manipulates food for mastication.
A muscular hydrostat on the floors of the mouths of most vertebrates which manipulates food for mastication
A mobile mass of muscular tissue covered with mucous membrane and located in the oral cavity
Organ that tastes and facilitates speech

The flexible muscular organ in the mouth that is used to move food around, for tasting and that is moved into various positions to modify the flow of air from the lungs in order to produce different sounds in speech.

The flexible muscular organ in the mouth that is used to move food around, for tasting and that is moved into various positions to modify the flow of air from the lungs in order to produce different sounds.

bn:00056135n: Mouths are a part of the anatomy constituting the first portion of the alimentary canal that receives food and saliva.
The opening through which food is taken in and vocalizations emerge
First portion of the alimentary canal that receives food

In biological anatomy, commonly referred to as the mouth, under formal names such as the oral cavity, buccal cavity, or in Latin cavum oris, is the opening through which many animals take in food and issue vocal sounds.
Cavity that is limited by the lips in front, the cheeks on the side, the soft and hard palate at the top and the floor of the mouth below.
The opening of a creature through which food is ingested.

bn:00076968n: Thirst is the craving for fluids, resulting in the basic instinct of animals to drink.
